name: Radiation-Induced Brachial Plexopathy
chief_complaint: Numbness and weakness in my right arm, especially when lifting things
physical_findings: Positive Tinel's sign at supraclavicular fossa

lab_results.EMG: Delayed conduction velocities in brachial plexus
lab_results.MRI: Fibrotic changes in brachial plexus without tumor recurrence

treatment: Physical therapy to maintain range of motion
prognosis: Variable; some patients stabilize while others experience progressive deterioration. Complete recovery is uncommon due to neural fibrosis.
description: Delayed radiation injury to the brachial plexus occurring 6 months to several years after radiation therapy (typically for breast cancer or lymphoma). Characterized by progressive fibrosis of neural tissues leading to sensorimotor deficits. Differential includes tumor recurrence or metastatic compression.
risk_factors: Previous high-dose radiation to supraclavicular region (>60Gy)
